page.title: 02Ditchling Area Conservation
page.content: This is an area of undulating lowland nestling under the South Downs where the soil is mainly fertile greensand, perfect for growing crops and garden plants. Wild flowers abound such as ragwort,meadowsweet,willow herb,vetch, cornflower,daisy,buttercup,primrose, bluebell,clover and campion.Poppies are appearing after an absence of several years.Local birds include chaffinch,wren,sparrow,starling,hedge sparrow,various tits,goldfinch,black- bird and thrust.Butterflies are becoming rare but the red admiral, peacock,brimstone,orange tip,meadow brown and tortoise shell can be seen. People are becoming interested in con- serving the countryside and walking is a popular pastime.Old footpaths are being kept open and styles are repaired so that everybody is able to gain access to fields and woods.
